meanings.definition: Firmly fixed or fastened in place.
meanings.sent1: The bookshelf was tite against the wall.
meanings.sent2: Make sure the lid is tite on the jar.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's tite grip on the acorn was impressive.
meanings.sent4: Her resolve was as tite as a drum, unwavering in the face of challenges.
meanings.sent5: The knot was so tite that it wouldn't budge.

meanings.definition: A slang term for something that is cool or impressive.
meanings.sent1: His new car is tite with all the latest features.
meanings.sent2: The concert last night was so tite, everyone had a great time.
meanings.sent3: She thought her dance moves were tite, but they made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The skateboarder's tricks were tite, like poetry in motion.
meanings.sent5: The artwork on the wall was incredibly tite, drawing everyone's attention.
